Lurch907

Anchorage Daily News, Anchorage, Alaska, 11/4/2006 
 
 WHEN MATTHEW SCHNEIDER pulled into his driveway and got out of his truck, three teenagers approached and began an altercation. According to authorities, Schneider told the youths to vacate his property, but they began assaulting him, even slamming the truck door on his head. Schneider, who has a concealed carry permit, reached for his .4o pistol and fired twice at his assailants. "I thought they were going to kill me if I didn't do something," Schneider said. Two suspects fled, one of them wounded, while a third collapsed. Schneider says he prayed for the fallen suspect to survive, but he died at the scene

 BTW, here in Alaska he didn't need to have a concealed carry permit. Here, if you can legally own a gun you can carry it with a few exceptions.

 I think he did every thing right. All in self-defense. I probably would have reacted a bit earlier, but hey at least the guy is alive. I heard of similar situation in Delaware where a suspect put something behind a guys back asking for his stuff, unfortunately for them he was armed (open carrying) and shot the guy. The suspects ran away only to find one guy going to the hospital with a gun shot wound. When someone puts what appears to be a gun behind your back and asks for the money, you have 50, 50 chance of living or dying. I'd rather make my own chance and try to live.
